prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered end** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0214, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a new face (face\_1) and add loop\_1 to it. Loop\_1 should consist of 4 curves - arc\_1, line\_1, arc\_2, and line\_2. * arc\_1 starts at [0.0, 0.0643] and ends at [0.0643, 0.0] with a mid point at [0.0643, 0.0643] * line\_1 starts at [0.0643, 0.0] and ends at [0.0643, 0.6857] * arc\_2 starts at [0.0643, 0.6857] and ends at [0.0, 0.6857] with a mid point at [0.0321, 0.75] * line\_2 starts at [0.0, 0.6857] and ends at [0.0, 0.0643] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.0214 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. Set the operation as 'New Body'. **Part 2: Create a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center** Create a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0321, 0.0, 0.0643]. For the sketch, create two faces (face\_1 and face\_2). In face\_1, add loop\_1 and a circle (circle\_1) in it. The circle should have its center at [0.0321, 0.0321] and a radius of 0.0321. Similarly, in face\_2, add another loop\_1 and circle\_1 with the center at [0.0321, 0.5893] and a radius of 0.0321. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6214. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0 units towards the normal and 0.1071 units in the opposite direction. Set the operation as 'Cut'. The resulting model should be a rectangular metal bar with a hole on one end, as described in the prompt. Make sure that all dimensions match those provided in the JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A 3D model of a rectangular prism with a square hole in the center, placed on a flat surface. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.6866, 0.0]. 1. **Create the first face (face\_1) of the sketch:** 1.1. Draw a line from the point [0.0, 0.0] to the point [0.2881, 0.0]. 1.2. Draw a line from the point [0.2881, 0.0] to the point [0.2881, 0.2881]. 1.3. Draw a line from the point [0.2881, 0.2881] to the point [0.0, 0.2881]. 1.4. Draw a line from the point [0.0, 0.2881] to the point [0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Create the second face (face\_2) of the sketch:** 2.1. Draw a line from the point [0.0634, 0.0634] to the point [0.2247, 0.0634]. 2.2. Draw a line from the point [0.2247, 0.0634] to the point [0.2247, 0.2247]. 2.3. Draw a line from the point [0.2247, 0.2247] to the point [0.0634, 0.2247]. 2.4. Draw a line from the point [0.0634, 0.2247] to the point [0.0634, 0.0634]. The sketch is now composed of two faces, each with one loop, which contains four lines. The shape has a length of 0.2881, a width of 0.0634, and a height of 0.2881. Extrude the sketch_scale (0.2881) along the opposite normal direction (0.0634) to create a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a square hole in the center, placed on a flat surface. Part 2: A CAD model of a simple geometric shape, consisting of three rectangular prisms, each with a flat top and bottom, arranged in a triangular configuration. Following the same coordinate system as Part 1, perform a 'JoinFeatureOperation' to combine the existing 3D model with the new CAD part. 1. **Create the first face (face\_1) of the new sketch:** 1.1. Draw a line from the point [0.0, 0.0] to the point [0.0634, 0.0]. 1.2. Draw a line from the point [0.0634, 0.0] to the point [0.0634, 0.0634]. 1.3. Draw a line from the point [0.0634, 0.0634] to the point [0.0, 0.0634]. 1.4. Draw a line from the point [0.0, 0.0634] to the point [0.0, 0.0]. Repeat the process for three more faces, rotating the shape 90 degrees for each new face, so that they are placed in a triangular configuration. The sketch is now composed of four faces, two lines for each side, with half of the lines being shared between the faces. The shape has a length of 0.2881, a width of 0.6242, and a height of 0.2881. Extrude the sketch_scale (0.2881) along the normal direction (0.6242) to create the final CAD model of a simple geometric shape, consisting of three rectangular prisms, each with a flat top and bottom, arranged in a triangular configuration.</description>
